sen.j: 白河院・鳥羽天皇に仕え、検非違使、皇后宮大進、兵庫頭、また下総国、下野国の国司などを歴任。
sen.e: Nakamasa served Shirakawa in/Emperor Toba and was appointed Kebiishi (police and justice chief), Kotaigu no daishin (Senior office secretary of the Empress' quarters), Hyogo no kami (Provincial governor of Hyogo), and Kokushi (local governor) for Shimousa and Shimotsuka Provinces.

sen.j: 元永・保安 (元号)年間（1118年－1124年）には、西国で朝廷に背いて追討を受けていた源義親を自称する者が出現した。
sen.e: During the years 1118 to 1124, there was a person who claimed to be MINAMOTO no Yoshichika, the warlord who betrayed the Imperial Court in the East country and was exiled.

sen.j: 和歌の道を通して源俊頼、藤原為忠、藤原俊忠、藤原俊成、藤原家成などといった中級貴族と親交が厚く、また摂政藤原師通の歌合にも招かれている。
sen.e: Through waka (31-syllable Japanese poems), he had close relations with middle class nobles, such as MINAMOTO no Toshiyori, FUJIWARA no Tametada, FUJIWARA no Toshitada, FUJIWARA no Toshinari and FUJIWARA no Ienari, and he was also invited to the poetry contest held by the regent, FUJIWARA no Moromichi.
